The following unneeded tests, test data, and Win32 buildstuffs for

author: sussman
msg: Some good progress on fixing libsvn_fs mem-leakage, issue #860.
This patch causes the httpd child to shrink from a max of 120M to 40M,
Every time the fs decides to flush buffered txdelta-window data into a
new strings-table row (about every 500K), it was creating a new db
txn, which created a new subpool, which was never freed until the
ENTIRE txdelta was received, and the parent file-baton pool was
I think we're seeing signs here of a flaw in the design of
svn_fs__retry_txn().  Brane points out that we probably have many
other similar leaks as a result of the fact that this function isn't
"allowed" to free the memory it allocates (apparently the mantra has
always been "it might contain important results the caller wants!").
We *should* be able to pass in a 'return-data' pool to
svn_fs__retry_txn, and after the db txn is done, allow the routine to
free whatever overhead memory it created.
* reps-strings.c (rep_write_contents):  don't just retry_txn in the
same old pool;  this creates a new trail subpool that is never
touched ever again.  Instead, just create and destroy a tmp subpool
for flushing data to the strings table.

author: brane
msg: * build/win32/build_neon.bat: Revert the r3467 change I committed by mistake.

author: brane
msg: Added support for building with both Berkeley DB 4.0.14 and 4.1.24.
Based on this patch by Justin Erenkrantz <jerenkrantz@apache.org>:
* bdb/bdb_compat.h: New header. Definitions for BDB 4.0/4.1 compatibility.
Include "bdb_compat.h" instead of <db.h>. In calls to DB->open, wrap
the environment and transaction parameter in SVN_BDB_OPEN_PARAMS. Pass
the SVN_BDB_AUTO_COMMIT flag to DB->open and DB->put wherever the
transaction is NULL. Check the BDB version before each call to
(cleanup_fs_db, cleanup_fs): Make usage of DB_INCOMPLETE conditional.
